news.content:
Our products mainly fall into four categories,namely Standard Herb Extracts,Protein Powder,Natural Colors and Mushroom Products. The following is a detailed introduction to our product.

Standard Herb Extracts are the collective name for extracts from herbs, plants, animals, etc. that have consistent standards. According to the different components of extracted plants, glycosides, acids, polyphenols, polysaccharides, terpenes, flavonoids, alkaloids, etc. are formed; according to different properties, they can be divided into vegetable oils, extracts, powders, lenses, etc. The main categories are as follows: Alkaloids: berberine (berberine), rolfsine, camptothecin, vincristine, etc. Glycosides: Amygdalin, salicin, cardiac glycosides, saponins, etc. Flavonoids: soybean isoflavones, flavones, flavonols; flavanones, flavanols, isoflavonenes, etc. Propolis, anthocyanins, green tea extract, ginkgo extract, etc. Organic acids: citric acid, lactic acid, tartaric acid, malic acid, ascorbic acid, oxalic acid, caffeic acid, chlorogenic acid, etc. Polysaccharides: edible mushroom polysaccharides, algae polysaccharides, Chinese herbal medicine polysaccharides, etc. Volatile oils: essential oils.

Plant Extracts:

Plant Extracts are biologically active compounds extracted from plants. Plant extracts are widely used in medicine, health products, cosmetics and other fields. Common plant extracts include Chinese Herbal Medicine Extracts, Fruit Extracts, Flower Extracts, etc.

Chinese Herbal Medicine Extracts refer to the active ingredients extracted from Chinese herbal medicine. Chinese herbal extracts have a long history in traditional medicine and are widely used to treat various diseases. For example, ginseng extract is used to improve immunity and physical strength, and angelica extract is used to regulate women's menstrual cycles.

Fruit Extracts are active ingredients extracted from fruits. Fruit extract is rich in nutrients such as vitamins, minerals and antioxidants, and has anti-aging, whitening, moisturizing and other effects. For example, grape seed extract is rich in antioxidants, which help fight free radical damage and improve skin elasticity.

Flower Extracts are active ingredients extracted from flowers. Flower extracts are often used in cosmetics and have soothing, anti-inflammatory, whitening and other effects. For example, chamomile extract is used to soothe sensitive skin, and rose extract is used to moisturize and brighten skin.

Animal Extracts are active ingredients extracted from animal tissues. Animal extracts are commonly used in medicine and health products. Common animal extracts include fish oil, honey, propolis, etc.

Microbial Extracts are active ingredients extracted from microorganisms. Microbial extracts are widely used in medicine and agriculture. Common microbial extracts include yeast extract, lactic acid bacteria extract, probiotic extract, etc. Yeast extract is the active ingredient extracted from yeast. Yeast extract is widely used in food, feed and cosmetics to enhance immunity and improve intestinal flora. Lactic acid bacteria extract is the active ingredient extracted from lactic acid bacteria. Lactic acid bacteria extract is used to make lactic acid bacteria drinks and health products, which can regulate intestinal flora and promote digestion. Probiotic extract is the active ingredient extracted from probiotic bacteria. Probiotic extracts are widely used in making probiotic products, which help maintain the balance of intestinal flora and promote digestion and absorption.

Protein Powder is generally a powder composed of purified soy protein, casein, and whey protein, and a combination of the above-mentioned proteins.

Soy protein: It is a kind of plant protein, which refers to the protein contained in soy products. Its amino acid composition is similar to that of the protein in milk. It is also rich in vitamins, dietary fiber, oligosaccharides, calcium, iron, Phosphorus and other minerals. Whey protein: It is a protein extracted from milk. It contains a variety of active ingredients, has high nutritional value, and is easy to digest and absorb. It is an animal protein that contains essential amino acids for the human body. A high-quality protein needed by the human body.

Pea protein: It is a protein separated and extracted from peas using a low-temperature and low-pressure process. It contains a variety of essential amino acids and is cholesterol-free.

Casein: It is a binding protein containing phosphorus and calcium. It is the main protein in mammals, such as cow's milk, goat's milk and human milk. It is the protein with the highest content in milk. It will precipitate when the pH value is low.
Lecithin: It contains glycerin, phospholipids, fatty acids and other substances. It is a yellow-brown oily substance that exists in animals, plants and egg yolks. It is rich in nutrients and is beneficial to promote brain development.

The purpose of Protein Powder is to supplement protein for people who lack protein. It is a health food. It has the functions of supplementing protein, promoting metabolism, improving intelligence, promoting growth and development, increasing muscle mass and strength, and helping to enhance physical fitness. In addition, protein powder can also improve Feeling full, reducing caloric intake in the diet, and helping to control weight. Some protein powders also have antioxidant properties, lower cholesterol, and enhance bone density.

Natural Colors are food pigments obtained from natural resources. Pigments mainly extracted from animal and plant tissues and microorganisms (culture), of which plant-based colorants account for the majority. Natural pigments not only color food, but also have physiological activity. It is highly safe and has almost no adverse effects on human health. At the same time, many natural food pigments also have certain outstanding health care functions and have certain preventive effects on various diseases of the human body.

Natural pigments of common colors are summarized as follows:

Red

Beet red pigment. Source: It is a natural product extracted from the roots of red beets of the genus Trichophyton. The main ingredient is betalain. Color: The aqueous solution is red to reddish purple. Solubility: Easily soluble in water, insoluble in grease. Stability: Stable within the pH range of 4.0~7.0: When the pH is less than 4.0 or greater than 7.0, the color of the solution changes from red to purple; when the pH exceeds 10.0, the color of the solution rapidly turns yellow, at which time betalains are converted into betalains. It has good dyeability, but poor heat resistance, and the degradation rate increases as the temperature rises. Light, oxygen, and excess oxidizing metal ions can also promote degradation. Ascorbic acid has a certain protective effect on it, and its stability increases as the water activity (Aw) of the food decreases. Beetroot powder is also commonly used in food to add color to food, and it can also give food a unique taste and aroma.

Lycopene (also known as ψ-carotene). Source: Produced by fermentation method, the strain used is Botrytis tripolaris. It is a carotenoid that does not contain oxygen. Color: Lycopene has different colors and intensities in different forms, and will show different colors with different solvents and media. For example, lycopene dissolved in petroleum ether appears yellow and in carbon disulfide appears red. Solubility: fat-soluble pigment. Stability: Lycopene is sensitive to photooxidation reaction. Fe3+ and Cu2+ in the solution will catalyze the photooxidation reaction of lycopene, while other metal ions such as K+, Mg2+, Ca2+, Zn2+, etc. have no effect on it. big. The pH value also affects lycopene. Lycopene is unstable to acid but relatively stable to alkali. Physiological activity: Lycopene is one of the strongest antioxidants currently found in plants in nature. It regulates cell growth and metabolism; it can regulate cholesterol metabolism; it has various health-care functions such as antioxidant, inhibiting mutation, reducing nucleic acid damage, reducing cardiovascular disease, and preventing cancer.

Chili red. Source: Powdered pigment made from red pepper fruit as raw material and extracted with hydrogen and carbon dioxide. A type of carotenoid. The main ingredients are capsorubin and capsorubin. Color: It is a deep red liquid with bright color and strong tinting power. Solubility: Soluble in grease and ethanol, it can also be made into water-soluble or water-dispersible pigments through special processing. Stability: The light resistance is poor. Capsicum red pigment stored in oily medium in the dark is relatively stable. The higher the temperature, the greater the loss of capsicum red pigment. The stability is good at 25~80℃. When the temperature rises to 80~100℃, the stability decreases. When the temperature exceeds 100℃, the pigment is extremely unstable.

Monascus red. Source: It is a liquid Monascus pigment obtained by extracting red yeast rice with ethanol or a product extracted, crystallized and refined from the deep culture medium of Monascus. Color: dark purple-red liquid or powder or paste, with a slight odor. Solubility: Easily soluble in neutral and alkaline aqueous solutions. Very soluble in ethanol, propylene glycol, glycerol and their aqueous solutions. Stability: Stable to environmental pH, almost unaffected by oxidants and reducing agents such as metal ions, hydrogen peroxide, vitamin C, and sodium sulfite. It has strong heat resistance and acid resistance, and its alcohol solution is quite stable to ultraviolet rays, but it can fade when exposed to direct sunlight. Excellent coloring properties for proteins. Physiological activity: Monascus red has bacteriostatic and bactericidal effects, and it has been confirmed that part of the antibacterial active ingredients are coloring substances.

Cochineal. Source: Cochineal is an organic compound and a natural pigment extracted from the female cochineal beetles growing on cacti. Color: The hue is pink to purple. In alkalis and dilute acids, the color changes with the pH of the solution. It is orange-yellow when it is acidic, dark red when it is neutral, and purple-red when it is alkaline. It turns black when encountering Fe3+. Solubility: Insoluble in cold water, slightly soluble in hot water or ethanol. Soluble in alkali, insoluble in dilute acid, insoluble in ether, chloroform and benzene. Stability: It is the natural pigment with the best light stability and thermal stability, with a decomposition temperature of 250°C. Physiological activity: It has a significant effect on preventing DNA damage caused by carcinogens, and can be used for the prevention and treatment of viral diseases (such as vesicular stomatitis, herpetic stomatitis, etc.), cancer and AIDS. The difference between cochineal and cochineal: Carmine is the most widely used monoazo synthetic pigment in the world.

Orange & Yellow

β-carotene. Source: Produced by fermentation method, the strain used is Botrytis tripolaris. Generally, the more colorful fruits or vegetables, the more beta-carotene they contain. Color: Due to differences in concentration, its color can cover all colors from red to yellow. Solubility: β-carotene is an edible oil-soluble pigment, and microencapsulated β-carotene can be converted into a water-soluble pigment. Stability: It is the most ubiquitous and stable natural pigment in nature. Physiological activity: It can be converted into vitamin A. It is also an antioxidant and has detoxification effects. It has significant functions in anti-cancer, preventing cardiovascular diseases, cataracts, etc., and further prevents aging and various degenerative diseases caused by aging.

Annatto. Source: Derived from the annatto tree, also known as redwood. Color: yellow-orange. Solubility: Depending on the preparation method, there are two types: water-soluble and oil-soluble. Water-soluble annatto is a red to brown liquid, block, powder or paste. Slightly smelly. The main pigment component is the sodium or potassium salt of norbixin, the hydrolyzate of bixin, which has very good dyeing properties but poor sunlight resistance. Soluble in water, the aqueous solution is yellow-orange and alkaline. Slightly soluble in ethanol. Insoluble in acidic conditions. The pH value should be around 8.0 when using this product. Oil-soluble annatto is a red to brown solution or suspension. The main pigment component is bixin. Soluble in alkaline solution, insoluble in acidic solution and may form a precipitate. Insoluble in water, soluble in grease, propylene glycol and acetone. Not easily oxidized. Stability: Strong heat resistance, can withstand high temperatures of 180℃ without discoloration and has stable color.

Curcumin. Source: Extracted from the rhizomes of ginger plants such as turmeric. Color: reddish brown when alkaline, yellow when neutral or acidic. Solubility: Insoluble in water, soluble in ethanol and propylene glycol, easily soluble in glacial acetic acid and alkali solutions. Stability: Strong stability to reducing agents, but sensitive to light, heat, and iron ions, and poor light resistance, heat resistance, and iron ion resistance. Physiological activity: Anti-oxidant, anti-inflammatory, anti-coagulant, lipid-lowering, anti-atherosclerosis, anti-aging, eliminating free radicals and inhibiting tumor growth.

Gardenia yellow pigment. Source: Dried and mature fruits of Rubiaceae plant Gardenia. Color: It is generally orange-yellow powder or dark yellow liquid. Its main components are crocin and crocetic acid, which are rare water-soluble carotenoids. The aqueous solution is lemon yellow. Solubility: Easily soluble in water. Stability: good stability and strong tinting power. It has good reduction resistance, microbial resistance, light resistance, heat resistance, basically unchanged color within the pH range of 4-11, and is stable to metal ions; it has good dyeing effect on starch and protein. Physiological activity: It is easily absorbed by the human body and can be converted into vitamin A in the human body. It can supplement the body's vitamin deficiencies and is a nutritional coloring agent. Gardenia is a commonly used traditional Chinese medicine. Gardenia yellow has similar effects to gardenia. It has the functions of clearing away heat and dispelling fire, cooling blood and promoting gallbladder, and lowering cholesterol. It has certain health care functions. It is a multifunctional medicine that integrates coloring, nutrition, and health care. of natural plant pigments.

Green

Chlorophyll copper sodium salt. Source: spinach or silkworm dung can be used as raw material, extract chlorophyll with acetone or ethanol, add an appropriate amount of copper sulfate, and the magnesium atom in the chlorophyll porphyrin ring is replaced by copper to generate it. Color: It is a dark green powder with strong tinting power and bright color. Its aqueous solution is a blue-green clear and transparent liquid, and precipitation occurs when calcium ions are present. Solubility: soluble in water. Stability: Slightly less stable to light and heat. Precipitation occurs in the presence of acidic solutions and calcium ions. Physiological activity: accelerates wound healing. It is effective in fighting cancer and anti-tumor.

Blue

Gardenia blue. Source: Gardenia blue is a refined natural pigment made from gardenia blue pigment. Gardenia blue pigment is a yellow pigment extracted from the fruit of the Rubiaceae plant, Gardenia jasminoides, and then treated with food enzymes. Color: light gray to dark blue powder or liquid. Solubility: easily soluble in water, aqueous ethanol, aqueous propylene glycol and other hydrophilic solvents, insoluble in non-polar organic solvents, stability: good light resistance and heat resistance. The pH value is stable between 3 and 10. It does not fade when heated at 120°C for 60 minutes. It is almost unaffected by Ca2+, Mg2+, Al3+, etc., but becomes darker when exposed to Fe3+ and Sn2+ when it is acidic. In addition, butterfly pea flower petals, black wolfberry, etc. are rich in Anthocyanins give the blue color. It is used in various foods as a natural blue pigment.

Mushroom Products are an emerging natural active substance with broad application prospects. Fungi are microorganisms with extremely high biological diversity, and many types of fungi can be used in the preparation of extracts. Common fungi include Penicillium, Escherichia coli, fungi, yeast, etc. These fungi have a high content of active substances and can be used in the preparation of extracts.

The preparation of Mushroom Products is mainly divided into two steps: fermentation and extraction. First, the fungi are cultured in an appropriate culture medium. After a period of fermentation, the bacteria are fished out. After washing, crushing and other treatments, solvents are used for extraction. The extracted material is the Mushroom Product.

The main Mushroom Products are classified into the following categories: Agaricus blazei extract. Agaricus blazei has an almond flavor and is of high edible and nutritional value. Agaricus blazei polysaccharide is the active and active nutritional ingredient extracted from it. It is rich in protein and polysaccharide, and its content is much higher than that of other strains. Contains crude protein, crude fat, crude fiber, vitamin B, riboflavin and rich phosphorus, calcium, magnesium, zinc, iron, copper and other essential mineral elements for the human body. Ganoderma lucidum extract. Ganoderma is considered a very nutritious fungus in China and has been used for over 2,000 years. Ganoderma lucidum extract and Ganoderma lucidum polysaccharide are widely used in health care products. They can help the injured replenish their body with nutrition and quickly recover, and can also help ordinary people replenish their energy.

Mushroom Products have broad application prospects. In the field of medicine, fungal extracts can be used to prepare antibiotics, anti-tumor drugs, etc. In the food field, Mushroom Products can beused to prepare food additives, preservatives, etc. In the field of cosmetics, Mushroom Products can be used to prepare skin care products, beauty products, etc. In addition, Mushroom Products can also be used in environmental protection, agriculture and other fields.

menu.content:
As a professional plant extract supplier, GreenHerb Biological Technology Co., Ltd is committed to providing customers with high-quality, natural, and organic plant extract products. The company was established in 2017. After years of development, we have established a foothold in the industry. We always insist that high-quality products will definitely win the trust of customers. In terms of processing, we also have a professional team that strictly controls quality throughout the entire process from raw material, production, testing to sales. We advocate advanced production technology and scientific formulas to ensure that each product meets international quality standards and has the highest purity and activity.

We will provide you with thoughtful and nuanced services. Our sales teams have rich industry experience and professional knowledge about plant extracts, and can also provide customers with a full range of pre-sales, sales and after-sales services. Our logistics team can ensure timely delivery of goods, and we provide a variety of transportation methods to meet the different needs of our customers. Our management has many years of managerial experience and can provide the company with support in strategic planning and financial management.

Our products are also highly innovative which can used in food, cosmetics and other fields. We continuously develop new products to meet the changing needs of our customers. Our experienced R&D team is committed to researching products that meet standards and are of high quality. They constantly explore new extraction technologies and formulas to improve product quality and effectiveness. Our technical team can provide customers with technical support and suggestions on product use and application, and we also regularly launch new product application solutions to help customers better use our products.

Compared with others, we have unique advantages. Not only do we have our own GMP factory and R&D team, but our products have passed multiple international certifications, such as ISO22000, HACCP, Kosher and Halal, etc. We always insist on operating with integrity, maintain good business reputation, and have established long-term cooperative relationships with many well-known brands.

We are a professional, reliable and efficient plant extract company, and we look forward to establishing a long-term cooperative relationship with you.

What is Stevia Extract PowderIntroduction?

Stevia Extract Powder has arisen as a unique advantage in the domain of sugars, upsetting the manner in which we see pleasantness. Gotten from the leaves of the Stevia rebaudiana plant, local to South America, this normal sugar has acquired massive notoriety as a better option in contrast to conventional sugar. It is prestigious for its pleasantness without the calories, pursuing it an optimal decision for wellbeing cognizant buyers.

Ingredients

Steviol glycosides, which are the sweet blends found in the leaves of the Stevia plant, make up most of the Extract Powder. The extract's serious charm is a direct result of these glycosides, for instance, stevioside and rebaudioside A.

Functional Characteristics

Zero Calories: The Extract Powder's absence of calories is one of its primary selling focuses, pursuing it a famous decision for individuals attempting to cut calories.

Diabetic-Friendly: It is regarded as a natural and viable alternative to counterfeit sugars because it is derived from plants.

Natural Origin: Stevia rebaudiana extract is regarded as a natural and viable alternative to counterfeit sugars because it is derived from plants.

High Sweetness Intensity: Stevia is a lot sweeter than regular sugar, so you need less of it to get the same amount of sweetness.

Market Trends and Future Prospects: Stevia's notoriety has flooded because of expanding buyer familiarity with well-being and health. The market is seeing a developing interest for regular sugars, with Stevia Concentrate Powder situated at the front. As purchasers look for better decisions, what's to come possibilities for Stevia in the food and drink industry seem promising.

Certificate Of Analysis


Specifications 

ParameterSpecification
AppearanceWhite, fine powder
Used PartLeaf
Test MethodHPLC
Botanical SourceStevia rebaudiana
SpecificationStevioside 90%,99%;RA90%,,99%
SolubilitySoluble in water

Function 

Zero-Calorie Sweetening

The Powder's primary strength lies in its ability to provide sweetness without the caloric burden of regular sugar. This makes it a significant instrument for individuals trying to manage their weight and decrease calorie affirmation.

Blood Sugar Regulation

Stevia has earned respect for its capability to assist with controlling glucose levels, offering a protected improving choice for those with diabetes. Not at all like sugar, Stevia doesn't cause spikes in blood glucose, pursuing it a reasonable decision for people observing their glycemic file.

Oral Health Benefits

The shortfall of sucrose in the Extract Powder adds to worked on oral wellbeing. Not at all like sugar, Stevia doesn't advance tooth rot, making it a tooth-accommodating improving choice.

Application 

Food and Beverage Industry

Stevia Extract Powder has tracked down broad application in the food and refreshment industry, filling in as a characteristic sugar in a wide cluster of items. From drinks and candy stores to prepared merchandise and dairy items, Stevia improves the pleasantness of different consumables without settling for less on wellbeing.

Pharmaceuticals

Given its diabetic-accommodating nature and potential medical advantages, Stevia is progressively integrated into drug definitions, especially in the creation of without sugar meds and enhancements

Personal Care Products

The restorative and individual consideration industry has embraced the product as an improving specialist in items like toothpaste and mouthwash. Its zero-calorie and tooth-accommodating qualities pursue it a favored decision for producers planning to give better other options.

All in all, Stevia Extract Powder addresses a sweet unrest in the realm of sugars, offering a characteristic, zero-calorie elective with different applications.  Since this calorie-free sugar substitute is a popular choice for those looking for a healthier alternative to conventional sweeteners, As buyer inclinations keep on moving towards better decisions, Stevia's market presence is ready for supported development, pursuing it an essential decision for experts in the food, drug, and individual consideration businesses.

GreenHerb Biological 

In the realm of stevia  leaf extract powder, GreenHerb Biological stands out as a leading manufacturer and supplier. With a vast inventory and comprehensive certifications, GreenHerb Biological is committed to providing a one-stop standard service. The company supports OEM and ODM, ensuring flexibility for clients with specific requirements. Fast delivery, tight packaging, and the provision of testing support further underscore GreenHerb Biological's commitment to quality and customer satisfaction.

For more information or to explore partnership opportunities, please contact GreenHerb Biological at sales@greenherbbt.com.

What is Erythritol Powder?

Chemically speaking, Erythritol Powder is a sugar alcohol—a polyol or sugar alcohol. It is a characteristic sugar substitute that is acquiring notoriety in different enterprises. Erythritol bulk has become the go-to choice for health-conscious consumers and those who are in charge of conditions like diabetes because it has the same sweet flavor as sucrose but does not contain any additional calories.This article dives into the item subtleties, details, viability, application fields, market patterns, and future possibilities of it.

Ingredients

Erythritol Powder is gotten from normal sources like products of the soil food varieties. It is delivered through the maturation of glucose by specific yeasts, bringing about an item that is 60-70% as sweet as sucrose.

Certificate Of Analysis

Processing

The carbon sources for the production of erythritol are alkane, monosaccharide and disaccharide, glucose, fructose, mannose and sucrose are good carbon sources for the production of erythritol, among which the conversion rate of D-mannose is the highest, reaching 31.5%. However, due to the cost factor, glucose is mainly produced from starch raw materials such as wheat or corn by enzymatic degradation, which is fermented by highly permeable yeast or other strains. Candida, Sphaeroides, Trichospora, Trigonomyces and Pichia can produce erythritol. The industrial production process of erythritol fermentation is as follows: starch → liquefaction → saccharification → glucose → fermentation of production strain → filtration → chromatographic separation → purification → concentration → crystallization → separation → drying, and finally erythritol is obtained with an average yield of about 50%. Studies have shown that the fermentation method of erythritol is affected by many factors, such as the change of osmotic pressure significantly affects the formation of polyols, inorganic salts Mn2+ and Cu2+ can increase the yield of erythritol, and oxygen and temperature have effects on its yield. Compared with the chemical synthesis method, the fermentation method has more advantages in production.

Functional Characteristics

●Zero-Calorie Sweetener:Erythritol stands out as a nearly calorie-free sweetener, making it the best option for people who want to cut back on calories. This sugar substitute offers a faultless arrangement, conveying pleasantness without the additional calories, taking care of the inclinations of wellbeing cognizant buyers.

●Low Impact on Blood Sugar: Erythritol, boasting a glycemic index of zero, avoids elevating blood sugar levels, rendering it a safe choice for individuals managing diabetes. Its sweetening properties offer a diabetic-friendly alternative without impacting glucose levels, aligning with health-conscious dietary preferences.

●Dental Health:Dissimilar to sugar, erythritol doesn't promote tooth decay and, in fact, has demonstrated the ability to hinder oral bacteria growth. This attribute makes it a dental-friendly sweetener, supporting overall oral health without compromising on sweetness in various food and beverage applications.

Market Trends and Future Prospects

Future Prospects

Growing Demand

Personal Care Products

Its sans sugar nature forestalls pits, adding to dental wellbeing, and its utilization lines up with the developing interest for regular, tooth-accommodating options in oral cleanliness plans.

In conclusion, it is a versatile and highly sought-after ingredient in a variety of sectors. What is Wheat Germ Extract?

Wheat germ extract is a nutritious dietary supplement derived from the germ of the wheat kernel. The germ is the nutrient-dense embryo of the wheat seed that feeds the plant as it grows. Raw grain remove is plentiful in a wide cluster of nutrients, minerals, phytonutrients, and plant intensifies that offer numerous potential medical advantages.

It is a concentrated preparation made from the nutrient-rich germ portion of the wheat kernel. The germ makes up only about 2-3% of the wheat seed but contains the majority of its nutrients.

To produce spermidine powder, the germ is separated from the starchy endosperm during the milling process. The germ is then dried, ground into powder, and extracted to concentrate its beneficial compounds

The resulting extract is a brownish-yellow powder high in antioxidants, vitamins, minerals, and other bioactive plant compounds:

Nutritional Profile

- Protein - contains gluten and complete protein with all 9 essential amino acids

- Dietary fiber

- Vitamin E - high levels of tocopherols

- Vitamin B complex - thiamin, riboflavin, niacin, pantothenic acid

- Minerals - zinc, manganese, selenium

- Octacosanol - plant wax thought to have health benefits

- Phytosterols - plant forms of cholesterol linked to heart health

- Carotenoids - antioxidant pigments like lutein and zeaxanthin

- Phytochemicals - avenanthramides, phenolic acids, alkylresorcinols

Market Trends and Future Directions

Global demand for wheat germ extract continues to grow as research uncovers new health benefits. Key trends shaping the market include:

Increasing use in dietary supplements: It is being added to multivitamins, antioxidant blends, heart health formulas, and sports nutrition products.

New scientific studies: researchers are actively studying the extract for benefits ranging from cancer prevention to male fertility support.

Rising demand in Asia: India and China are major growth markets for its supplements.

In the future, more potent extracted fractions, combination formulas, and synergistic ingredient pairings can help maximize the extract's health benefits. Processes to reduce gluten content could also expand its applications.

Features and Applications

The extract is valued for its unique nutritional profile rich in vitamins, minerals, antioxidants, and other beneficial phytochemicals. These components give wheat germ extract diverse functional characteristics that make it useful across many industries:

Antioxidant activity: With high levels of vitamin E, carotenoids, and polyphenols, it is a potent antioxidant that can protect against lipid oxidation and free radical damage in food products and dietary supplements. This helps maintain freshness and prevents nutritional degradation.

Immune support: The extract stimulates immune function through its vitamin, mineral, and phytochemical content. This makes it an attractive ingredient in supplements aimed at boosting immunity and preventing infections. Its anti-inflammatory effects also help modulate excessive immune responses.

Heart health: Multiple compounds in it improve cholesterol levels, blood pressure, circulation, and other cardiovascular parameters. This supports its use in functional foods and supplements for maintaining heart health.

Anti-aging: As a rich antioxidant, it neutralizes free radicals implicated in accelerated aging. Topically applied, it nourishes skin and protects against UV damage. Its anti-aging effects make it useful in cosmetics, skincare, and hair care products.

Muscle building: Emerging research shows the extract’s potential to increase athletic performance, endurance, strength, and workout recovery. This can support supplementation by athletes and in sports nutrition products.

Weight management: With its fiber, plant proteins, and potential to boost fat burning, the extract may aid weight control when included in diet formulas, meal replacements, and weight loss supplements.

The extract is a versatile functional ingredient whose multifaceted health benefits make it suitable for products targeting immunity, heart health, anti-aging, sports nutrition, weight management, and overall wellness.

What is Amygdalin B17?

Amygdalin, frequently alluded to as Amygdalin B17, is a characteristic compound tracked down in the seeds of specific organic products, especially apricots and severe almonds. It's critical to take note of that amygdalin has produced contention, particularly in regards to its supposed medical advantages, especially in disease therapy. It's general characteristics are as follows:

1. Compositional Chemistry:

Amygdalin B17 is a glycoside, a compound containing a sugar particle joined to a non-sugar particle. A cyanogenic glycoside is what it is called.

Basically, amygdalin comprises of a nitrile bunch joined to a sugar particle (glucose) and is frequently connected with a benzene ring.

2. Normal Sources:

Amygdalin is tracked down in the seeds (pieces) of specific organic products, with apricot seeds being a remarkable source.

Unpleasant almonds likewise normally contain amygdalin. Nonetheless, it's essential to take note of that harsh almonds are not usually consumed because of the presence of cyanide.

Market Trends and Future Prospects

The market for it is seeing a flood popular, driven by the rising consciousness of normal wellbeing choices. The pharmaceutical and dietary supplement industries are looking into incorporating it into a variety of products as consumers look for natural and plant-derived options.

Certificate Of Analysis

Apricot Kernel Extract Flow Chart

Functions

1. Amygdalin B17 is promoted as a natural cancer treatment. Advocates claim amygdalin is a non-toxic antineoplastic agent that can selectively kill cancer cells without harming normal cells. However, there is no scientific evidence backing its efficacy and safety as a cancer therapy.

2. Some claim amygdalin can relieve pain, prevent arthritis, and soothe inflammation. However, human studies are lacking and the proposed mechanisms are unproven. Further research is needed to verify if amygdalin actually provides these analgesic and anti-inflammatory effects.

3.  Supporters state amygdalin boosts the immune system and promotes overall health due to its vitamin and nutrient content. But other than providing some vitamin B and minerals, there is little proof of its generalized benefits for immunity or wellbeing. More controlled trials on humans are needed.

4. Advocates say amygdalin can help digestive issues by supporting gastrointestinal health and promoting the growth of probiotic bacteria in the gut. But these benefits remain speculative, with no solid clinical evidence.

5. Some proponents claim amygdalin can help prevent respiratory illnesses like colds and flus by boosting respiratory health. Again, this use still lacks verification through rigorous clinical studies.

6. Amygdalin may have antioxidant properties that help counteract cell damage by scavenging free radicals. However, research is still preliminary and mainly based on in vitro studies. Robust human trials are lacking.

Application

  1. Drug Industry: Bitter apricot kernel extract is being read up for its possible application in malignant growth therapies, and drug organizations are investigating its joining into prescriptions pointed toward battling specific sorts of diseases.

  2. Dietary Enhancements: it is acquiring ubiquity as a fixing in dietary enhancements that advance general well-being and health. Support for the immune system and antioxidant benefits are common goals of these supplements.

In conclusion, almond extract powder holds promise as a natural compound with potential health benefits, particularly in the fields of cancer research and immune system support. As market demand continues to grow, companies like GreenHerb Biological are at the forefront, providing quality products for various applications.

Schisandra Extract Powder, derived from the Schisandra chinensis plant, has gained considerable attention in the health and wellness industry for its potent therapeutic properties. What is Phycocyanin Powder?

In the consistently developing scene of wholesome enhancements, one substance that has caught the consideration of the two specialists and wellbeing aficionados the same is Phycocyanin Powder. Removed from spirulina, a sort of blue green growth prestigious for its rich supplement profile, Phycocyanin Powder has turned into a vital participant in the wellbeing and health industry. This lively blue shade isn't just outwardly striking yet additionally harbors a heap of medical advantages, making it a sought-after fixing in different applications.

Ingredients and Functional Characteristics:

Ingredients:

  1. Phycocyanin:

    Blue spirulina: Phycocyanin powder is a water-soluble pigment responsible for the pure blue color of blue-green algae.

    Protein Complex: It is a protein complex, consisting of a chromophore (the pigment) and a protein component.

  2. Chromophore:

    Phycoerythrobilin: The chromophore of phycocyanin is phycoerythrobilin, which is responsible for the bulk blue color and also contributes to its antioxidant properties.

  3. Protein Component:

    Phycocyanobilin: The protein component of phycocyanin is called phycocyanobilin. It binds with the chromophore and forms the complete phycocyanin molecule.


Functional Characteristics:

  1. Antioxidant Properties:

    Free Radical Scavenger: Phycocyanin exhibits antioxidant activity, helping to neutralize free radicals and reduce oxidative stress in the body.

  2. Anti-Inflammatory Effects:

    Modulation of Inflammation: Phycocyanin has been studied for its potential anti-inflammatory effects, which may contribute to its role in supporting overall health.

  3. Immune System Support:

    Immunomodulation: Some research suggests that phycocyanin may modulate the immune system, potentially enhancing immune function.

  4. Detoxification:

Beet root red overwhelmingly comprises of betalains, an assortment of colors responsible for its particular red shade.
